group_1.textLeft: How's your wound?

group_1.textRight: It's getting better, but it seems I'm going to be@hospitalized a little longer.
I would like to be discharged...
...and get back to interviewing all the Magical Girls,@though...

group_1.textLeft: ...Don't be pushin' yourself so hard.
If something's going on in Futatsugi,
all the Promised Blood girls will come tell you when@they check up on you,
so there's no rush.

group_1.textRight: Yeah... Thank you, Urara.

group_1.textLeft: ...I understand too, the feeling of being unable@to do anything...

group_1.textRight: You're right...
You want to get back too, don't you.@To Miss Kureha and everyone...

group_1.textLeft: ...Nope, I'm Folklore of Zero,
so it'll be back to Rabi's group for me.

group_1.textRight: Ah...so you are...
But to everyone in Promised Blood, you're...

group_1.textLeft: Besides Yuna, I haven't revealed who I am@to anyone,
and I don't intend to.

group_1.textRight: I see...
But maybe that is for the best, you know...
I've heard that Futatsugi is in chaos now...
Um, may I ask something about you, Urara...?

group_1.textLeft: You talkin' 'bout an interview?@If so, I don't really mind.
Back in Yukuni, I formed a street performance duo...
...and did radio entertainment,
so I'm used to interviews. I could even tell ya some@funny episodes about my house!

group_1.textRight: Um, I'd love to hear all about that too, but...
Urara,
why did you infiltrate Promised Blood?

group_1.textLeft: S-so that's what ya meant!
You're into interviewing Magical Girls,
so of course you wouldn't care about@funny episodes!

group_1.textRight: *Giggle*...@You can tell me about them later.

group_1.textLeft: Let's see...the reason I infiltrated Promised Blood...

group_1.textCenter: To watch over the conflict in Kamihama,@Asahi, Sasha, Urara,
I want you to infiltrate each group and spy on their@tendencies.

group_1.textRight: Gotcha!

group_1.textLeft: I was requested by the professor...
...to stay close to his daughter, Nayuta, to ensure@no harm comes to her.

group_1.textRight: I carry the blood of the Tokime Clan in my body.
As I was just summoned by the head,
I believe I am qualified to infiltrate them.

group_1.textLeft: Indeed, please do.
Sasha, taking your character and method of@fighting into account,
I think Neo-Magius suits you best.
However, Neo-Magius has no stability as a group.
If you're not careful, they may disappear before@the full-scale conflict occurs.

group_1.textRight: I understand.@I'll watch over them as carefully as I canâ™ª
Then that leaves me...

group_1.textLeft: I would like you to infiltrate Promised Blood.

group_1.textRight: That group seems to never stop with the fighting.@I'm worried I won't be able to do it...

group_1.textLeft: There is a reason I'm nominating you, Urara.
You haven't been a Magical Girl for long,
but you've been athletic from the start, and you've@grown fast,
and on top of that, you're great at adapting and@likable by everyone.
Out of all of us, I think you'll fit in with Futatsugi@the most.

group_1.textRight: If you say so, Rabi...

group_1.textLeft: You may be anxious,
but they shouldn't make a newcomer do anything@reckless.
Besides, after the incident...
You're being transferred to an affiliated school,@aren't you?

group_1.textRight: Ah...yeah...

group_1.textLeft: That school is close to Futatsugi and has@a dormitory.
I think spying on Promised Blood will be a fairly@easy activity.

group_1.textRight: Heeh... So it was Miss Himuro's idea, then.

group_1.textLeft: Rabi is reliable,
but once in a while she'll say something that makes@me jump...

group_1.textRight: But I think Miss Himuro's prediction was spot on.
When I was interviewing Promised Blood,
everyone was praising you,
saying that Urara is so dedicated despite the@difficulties and has grown so much.

group_1.textLeft: Well, I AM valued for my energy and perseverance.

group_1.textRight: So you must have fit into the group right away.

group_1.textLeft: Well...@There were lots of problems too...
